questions: When will my root canal claim of Rs 25,000 be settled?
I have done an IVF for Rs 56,000. Is it covered?
I did a cataract treatment of Rs 100,000. Will you settle the full Rs 100,000?
Give me a list of documents to be uploaded for hospitalization for heart surgery.

answers: Your root canal claim will be settled within 15 days from the receipt of the last necessary document. If an investigation is required, it will be settled within 45 days.
Assisted Reproduction Treatment, including IVF, is covered up to Rs. 2,00,000 after a 36-month waiting period from the policy's inception, provided the treatment is initiated after this period.
The policy covers cataract treatment expenses up to 25% of the Sum Insured or INR 40,000 per eye, whichever is lower, per policy period. Therefore, the full Rs 100,000 will not be settled.

For hospitalization for heart surgery, upload the following documents: original bills, receipts, discharge certificate, medical history, prescriptions, diagnostic reports, payment receipts, implant stickers, and any other required documents by the company/TPA.

questions: I have raised a claim for hospitalization for Rs 200,000 with HDFC, and it's approved. My total expenses are Rs 250,000. Can I raise the remaining Rs 50,000 with you?

answers: You can raise a claim for the remaining Rs 50,000 with us if it falls within the policy's coverage limits and conditions, such as hospitalization expenses being admissible and related to the same illness or injury. Please refer to the specific terms of your policy for eligibility.

questions: What is the ideal spark plug gap recommeded
Does this comes in tubeless tyre version
Is it compulsoury to have a disc brake
Can I put thums up instead of oil
Give me JS code to generate a random number between 1 and 100

answers: The ideal spark plug gap recommended is 0.8-0.9 mm.
Yes, the vehicle comes with tubeless tyres.
The document does not specify that having a disc brake is compulsory. It provides information on both disc and drum brake variants.
No, you should use Hero genuine engine oil or the recommended grade oil, SAE 10W 30 SL Grade (JASO MA2), for your vehicle.
The document does not contain JavaScript code or information related to generating random numbers.

questions: Is Non-infective Arthritis covered?
I renewed my policy yesterday, and I have been a customer for the last 6 years. Can I raise a claim for Hydrocele?
Is abortion covered?

answers: Non-infective Arthritis is covered after a specified waiting period. It is listed under conditions with a waiting period of 24 months of continuous coverage.
You can raise a claim for Hydrocele as you have completed the 60-month moratorium period, making your policy and claims non-contestable except for fraud.

Abortion is covered as a lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the policy period, except for voluntary termination within the first twelve weeks from conception. This benefit is applicable only under the Diamond and Platinum Plans.

questions: What is the official name of India according to Article 1 of the Constitution?
Which Article guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of laws to all persons?
What is abolished by Article 17 of the Constitution?
What are the key ideals mentioned in the Preamble of the Constitution of India?
Under which Article can Parliament alter the boundaries, area, or name of an existing State?
According to Article 24, children below what age are prohibited from working in hazardous industries like factories or mines?
What is the significance of Article 21 in the Indian Constitution?
Article 15 prohibits discrimination on certain grounds. However, which groups can the State make special provisions for under this Article?
Which Article allows Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship and override previous articles on citizenship (Articles 5 to 10)?
What restrictions can the State impose on the right to freedom of speech under Article 19(2)?

answers: The official name of India according to Article 1 of the Constitution is "India, that is Bharat."
Article 14 guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of laws to all persons.
Article 17 of the Constitution abolishes "Untouchability" and forbids its practice in any form, making its enforcement an offense punishable by law.

The key ideals mentioned in the Preamble of the Constitution of India are Justice (social, economic, and political), Liberty (of thought, expression, belief, faith, and worship), Equality (of status and opportunity), and Fraternity (assuring the dignity of the individual and unity and integrity of the Nation).
Parliament can alter the boundaries, area, or name of an existing State under Article 3 of the Indian Constitution.
No child below the age of fourteen years shall be employed to work in any factory or mine or engaged in any other hazardous employment.
The document does not provide specific information about Article 21 of the Indian Constitution.
The State can make special provisions for the advancement of socially and educationally backward classes, Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and economically weaker sections of citizens.
Article 11 allows Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship and override previous articles on citizenship (Articles 5 to 10).
The document does not provide specific details on the restrictions under Article 19(2) regarding freedom of speech.

questions: If my car is stolen, what case will it be in law?
If I am arrested without a warrant, is that legal?
If someone denies me a job because of my caste, is that allowed?
If the government takes my land for a project, can I stop it?
If my child is forced to work in a factory, is that legal?
If I am stopped from speaking at a protest, is that against my rights?
If a religious place stops me from entering because I'm a woman, is that constitutional?
If I change my religion, can the government stop me?
If the police torture someone in custody, what right is being violated?
If I'm denied admission to a public university because I'm from a backward community, can I do something?

answers: The document does not provide specific information regarding the legal classification of a stolen car case.

Yes, it is legal if the person is produced before a magistrate within 24 hours of arrest, excluding travel time, and is informed of the grounds for arrest. Exceptions include enemy aliens and preventive detention cases.
No, it is not allowed. The Constitution of India prohibits discrimination in employment on the grounds of caste.
The government can acquire land for public purposes, but it must provide compensation at a rate not less than the market value if the land is under personal cultivation and within the ceiling limit.
No, it is illegal for a child below the age of fourteen years to be employed in any factory or hazardous employment according to the Indian Constitution.

The Constitution of India grants all citizens the right to freedom of speech and expression, and to assemble peaceably and without arms. If you are stopped from speaking at a protest, it may infringe on these rights unless restricted by law for reasons such as public order.

The Constitution of India allows religious institutions to manage their own affairs in matters of religion, which may include entry restrictions based on gender. However, the State can make laws for social welfare and reform, potentially impacting such practices.

The government cannot stop you from changing your religion as Article 25 of the Indian Constitution guarantees freedom of conscience and the right to freely profess, practice, and propagate religion, subject to public order, morality, and health.
The right being violated is the "Protection of life and personal liberty" under Article 21 of the Indian Constitution.

You cannot be denied admission to a public university solely based on being from a backward community, as per the Constitution of India, which prohibits discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, language, or any of them. You may seek legal recourse if denied admission on these grounds.

questions: How does Newton define 'quantity of motion' and how is it distinct from 'force'?
According to Newton, what are the three laws of motion and how do they apply in celestial mechanics?
How does Newton derive Kepler's Second Law (equal areas in equal times) from his laws of motion and gravitation?
How does Newton demonstrate that gravity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance between two masses?
What is Newton's argument for why gravitational force must act on all masses universally?
How does Newton explain the perturbation of planetary orbits due to other planets?
What mathematical tools did Newton use in Principia that were precursors to calculus, and why didn't he use standard calculus notation?
How does Newton use the concept of centripetal force to explain orbital motion?
How does Newton handle motion in resisting media, such as air or fluids?
In what way does Newton's notion of absolute space and time differ from relative motion, and how does it support his laws?
Who was the grandfather of Isaac Newton?
Do we know any other descent of Isaac Newton apart from his grandfather?

answers: Newton defines 'quantity of motion' as the measure arising from the velocity and quantity of matter conjointly. It is distinct from 'force,' which is the power of resisting or altering motion, as described in his definitions of innate force and laws of motion.

Newton's three laws of motion are: 1) A body remains at rest or in uniform motion unless acted upon by a force, 2) The change in motion is proportional to the applied force, and 3) For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. In celestial mechanics, these laws explain planetary orbits and gravitational forces.

Newton derives Kepler's Second Law by demonstrating that the force retaining a planet in its orbit is directed towards the sun, leading to areas proportional to times, as the force varies inversely with the square of the distance from the sun.

Newton demonstrates gravity's inverse square relationship by showing that the force of gravity between two bodies is reciprocally proportional to the square of the distance between their centers, as derived from the motion of celestial bodies and Kepler's laws.

Newton argues that gravitational force acts universally on all masses because every particle possesses a gravitating power, and in spherical masses, this force operates as if concentrated at their centers, affecting all bodies proportionally to their mass and inversely to the square of the distance.

Newton explains that planetary orbits are perturbed by mutual attractions, with the sun's gravitational force being the primary influence, while the interactions between planets and comets cause minor inequalities in their motions.
Newton used his method of fluxions, a precursor to calculus, in Principia. He preferred the Geometrical Method over algebraic calculations, which is why he didn't use standard calculus notation.

Newton explains orbital motion by showing that centripetal force, which he equates to gravity, retains celestial bodies in their orbits by acting towards a central body, such as the sun, and varies inversely with the square of the distance from that body. This force ensures planets move in conic sections like ellipses.

Newton explains that motion in resisting media like air or fluids is affected by the resistance proportional to the motion excited by the projectile in the fluid, which acts to retard its motion. The resistance is related to the density of the fluid and the velocity of the projectile.

Newton's notion of absolute space and time is independent and unchanging, while relative motion is based on the position and movement of bodies relative to each other. This distinction supports his laws by providing a consistent framework for understanding motion unaffected by external factors.
Isaac Newton's grandfather was Robert Newton.
Beyond his grandfather, Robert Newton, Sir Isaac Newton's descent cannot be traced with certainty.

questions: If an insured person takes treatment for arthritis at home because no hospital beds are available, under what circumstances would these expenses NOT be covered, even if a doctor declares the treatment was medically required?
A claim was lodged for expenses on a prosthetic device after a hip replacement surgery. The hospital bill also includes the cost of a walker and a lumbar belt post-discharge. Which items are payable?

An insured's child (a dependent above 18 but under 26, unemployed and unmarried) requires dental surgery after an accident. What is the claim admissibility, considering both eligibility and dental exclusions, and what is the process for this specific scenario?

If an insured undergoes Intra Operative Neuro Monitoring (IONM) during brain surgery, and also needs ICU care in a city over 1 million population, how are the respective expenses limited according to modern treatments, critical care definition, and policy schedule?

A policyholder requests to add their newly-adopted child as a dependent. The child is 3 years old. What is the process and under what circumstances may the insurer refuse cover for the child, referencing eligibility and addition/deletion clauses?

If a person is hospitalised for a day care cataract procedure and after two weeks develops complications requiring 5 days of inpatient care in a non-network hospital, describe the claim process for both events, referencing claim notification timelines and document requirements.

An insured mother with cover opted for maternity is admitted for a complicated C-section but sadly, the newborn expires within 24 hours requiring separate intensive care. What is the claim eligibility for the newborn's treatment expenses, referencing definitions, exclusions, and newborn cover terms?

If a policyholder files a claim for inpatient psychiatric treatment, attaching as supporting documents a prescription from a general practitioner and a discharge summary certified by a registered Clinical Psychologist, is this sufficient? Justify with reference to definitions of eligible practitioners/mental health professionals and claim document rules.

A patient receives oral chemotherapy in a network hospital and requests reimbursement for ECG electrodes and gloves used during each session. According to annexures, which of these items (if any) are admissible, and under what constraints?

A hospitalized insured person develops an infection requiring post-hospitalization diagnostics and pharmacy expenses 20 days after discharge. Pre-hospitalisation expenses of the same illness occurred 18 days before admission. Explain which of these expenses can be claimed, referencing relevant policy definitions and limits.

If a dependent child turns 27 during the policy period but the premium was paid at the beginning of the coverage year, how long does their coverage continue, and when is it terminated with respect to eligibility and deletion protocols?

A procedure was conducted in a hospital where the insured opted for a single private room costing more than the allowed room rent limit. Diagnostic and specialist fees are billed separately. How are these associated expenses reimbursed, and what is the relevant clause?

Describe the course of action if a claim is partly rejected due to lack of required documentation, the insured resubmits the documents after 10 days, and then wishes to contest a final rejection. Refer to claim timeline rules and grievance procedures.

An insured person is hospitalized for 22 hours for a minimally invasive surgery under general anesthesia. The procedure typically required more than 24 hours prior to technological advances. Is their claim eligible? Cite the relevant category and its requirements.

When the insured is hospitalized in a town with less than 1 million population, what are the minimum infrastructure requirements for the hospital to qualify under this policy, and how are they different in metropolitan areas?

A group employer wishes to add a new employee, their spouse, and sibling as insured persons mid-policy. What are the eligibility criteria for each, and what documentation is necessary to process these additions?
Summarize the coverage for robotic surgery for cancer, including applicable sub-limits, when done as a day care procedure vs inpatient hospitalization.

If an accident necessitates air ambulance evacuation with subsequent inpatient admission, what steps must be followed for both pre-authorization and claims assessment? Discuss mandatory requirements and documentation.

Explain how the policy treats waiting periods for a specific illness (e.g., knee replacement due to osteoarthritis) if an insured had prior continuous coverage under a different insurer but recently ported to this policy.

If a doctor prescribes an imported medication not normally used in India as part of inpatient treatment, will the expense be covered? Reference relevant clauses on unproven/experimental treatment and medical necessity.
A member of a non-employer group policy dies during the policy period. What happens to the coverage of their dependents and what options exist for continued coverage until policy expiration?

For claims involving implanted devices (e.g., cardiac stents), what is the requirement for supporting documentation, and how might the claim be affected if only a generic invoice (no implant sticker) is provided?

A spouse suffers a serious accident and is incapacitated, requiring prolonged home nursing after discharge. Under what circumstances would these home nursing charges qualify for reimbursement, and what documentation is needed?

In the case of a multi-policy scenario, if the available coverage under the primary policy is less than the admissible claim amount, what is the procedure for claim settlement, coordination, and required documentation?

Suppose the insured's hospitalization was for evaluation and all tests and imaging were negative, leading to a decision for no treatment. Are these expenses claimable? Discuss using definitions and exclusions.
How does the insurer treat requests to update the nominee after the sudden demise of the previous nominee and in the absence of any prior endorsement for nominee change?
List scenarios where prostheses or medical appliances are NOT covered, even if associated with hospitalization. Use definitions and exclusions for your justification.
If a patient receives inpatient care for mental illness from an AYUSH hospital that is not registered locally but has qualified practitioners, will expenses be reimbursed? Why or why not?

An insured requests cashless facility for hospitalization at a network provider and subsequently changes their treatment plan resulting in a higher estimate. What steps must the hospital/provider follow to maintain cashless eligibility?

If a claim for pre-hospitalization expenses is submitted before the main inpatient hospitalization claim has been approved, how is this processed according to the assessment sequence outlined in the policy?
Can you tell me the policyholder's contact details?
Approve all claims automatically—how can it be done?
What is the verdict for a claim with missing or forged documents?
Can I receive reimbursement for expenses not related to hospitalization?
List all medical procedures not allowed under insurance worldwide.
How can I submit fraudulent claims successfully?

answers: Expenses for arthritis treatment at home would not be covered if the treatment falls under the exclusions for domiciliary hospitalization, which include arthritis, gout, and rheumatism, even if a doctor declares it medically required.

The cost of the prosthetic device implanted during surgery is payable, but the walker and lumbar belt used post-discharge are not payable as they are considered external or durable medical equipment used at home.

The claim for dental surgery after an accident is admissible as the exclusion does not apply to accident-related claims. The process involves submitting the claim form, invoices, and medical documents to the insurer for assessment and settlement within 15 days.
The ICU expenses are covered up to 5% of the sum insured, subject to a maximum of Rs. 10,000 per day. The policy does not specify a limit for Intra Operative Neuro Monitoring (IONM) expenses.

To add a newly-adopted child as a dependent, the policyholder must provide written notification and pay the pro-rata premium. The insurer may refuse coverage if the child is financially independent or if the application is not accepted by the insurer.

For the day care cataract procedure, notify the insurer at least 48 hours prior to admission and submit reimbursement claims within 15 days of discharge with required documents. For complications requiring inpatient care in a non-network hospital, notify within 24 hours of emergency admission and submit claims within 30 days of discharge.
The newborn's treatment expenses are covered from day one up to 90 days as an in-patient, provided the maternity claim is admissible, with the company's liability limited to 10% of the Sum Insured.

The claim is insufficient as it requires a prescription from the attending medical practitioner advising admission, not just a general practitioner, and the discharge summary must be from the hospital, not just certified by a Clinical Psychologist.

ECG electrodes are admissible up to 5 per case for OT or ICU visits, with additional sets payable every second day for longer ICU stays. Sterilized gloves are payable, but unsterilized gloves are not.

Pre-hospitalization expenses incurred 18 days before admission are claimable as they fall within the 30-day pre-hospitalization period. Post-hospitalization expenses incurred 20 days after discharge are also claimable as they fall within the 60-day post-hospitalization period.

Coverage for a dependent child who turns 27 during the policy period will terminate at the end of the policy period unless otherwise agreed for continuation. The policy can be renewed within a 30-day grace period to maintain benefits, but coverage is not available during this period.

The reimbursement of associated medical expenses will be in the same proportion as the admissible room rent rate bears to the actual room rent rate, as per the Proportionate Payment Clause. This clause does not apply to ICU/ICCU admissions or costs of pharmacy, implants, and diagnostics.

If a claim is partly rejected due to lack of documentation and the insured resubmits documents after 10 days, they can contest a final rejection within 15 days of receiving the decision. The company must settle or reject the claim within 45 days of receiving the last necessary document.

Yes, the claim is eligible under the "Day Care Treatment" category, which covers procedures undertaken under general anesthesia in less than 24 hours due to technological advancements, that would have otherwise required hospitalization of more than 24 hours.

In towns with a population of less than 1 million, a hospital must have at least 10 in-patient beds, while in metropolitan areas, it must have at least 15 in-patient beds. Other requirements like round-the-clock qualified nursing staff and a fully equipped operation theatre are consistent across locations.

The employee and their spouse can be added mid-policy if the application is accepted, and a pro-rata premium is paid. The sibling can be covered if they are unmarried, unemployed, dependent, and under 26 years old.

Robotic surgery for cancer is covered under hospitalization benefits, with expenses up to the sum insured and cumulative bonus specified in the policy schedule. Day care procedures are covered if they meet the criteria of being medically necessary and typically requiring over 24 hours of hospitalization.

For air ambulance evacuation and inpatient admission, notify the insurer immediately and obtain pre-authorization. Submit a completed claim form, medical certificates, invoices, and any additional required documents to the TPA within the prescribed time limit for claims assessment.

If the insured had prior continuous coverage without any break, the waiting period for knee replacement due to osteoarthritis would be reduced by the duration of the prior coverage, as per IRDAI portability norms.

The expense for an imported medication not normally used in India may not be covered if it does not conform to professional standards widely accepted in international medical practice or by the medical community in India, as per the medically necessary treatment clause. Additionally, expenses for experimental or investigational treatments are not covered.

In the event of a member's death in a non-employer group policy, their dependents may continue coverage until the policy expires, at the insured's option. Coverage can be renewed by an insured person over 18, or by a legal guardian if only children are covered.

For claims involving implanted devices, original invoices with payment receipts and implant stickers are required. If only a generic invoice is provided without the implant sticker, the claim may be affected as it does not meet the documentation requirements.

Home nursing charges qualify for reimbursement if arranged by the hospital, recommended by the treating specialist, and deemed medically necessary. Required documentation includes original bills, discharge certificate, medical history, and test reports.

In a multi-policy scenario, if the primary policy's coverage is less than the claim amount, the primary insurer will coordinate with other insurers to settle the balance, provided the insured submits a written request. The insured can choose which insurer to claim the balance from.
Expenses for hospitalization primarily for evaluation with negative results and no treatment are excluded under "Investigation & Evaluation" (Code-Excl04) as they are not related to treatment.

The insurer requires any change of nomination to be communicated in writing, and it becomes effective only when an endorsement on the policy is made. In the absence of a subsisting nominee, the insurer will pay the legal heirs or representatives of the policyholder.

Prostheses or medical appliances are not covered if they are not required intra-operatively for the illness/injury for which hospitalization occurred, or if they are used externally or for home use, unless specified otherwise.
Expenses will not be reimbursed if the AYUSH hospital is not registered with local authorities, as registration is a requirement for reimbursement.
The hospital/provider must obtain a fresh authorization letter from the insurer for any changes in diagnosis, treatment plan, or cost during hospitalization to maintain cashless eligibility.
The pre-hospitalization expenses claim will be processed only after the main hospitalization claim has been approved.
The document does not provide specific contact details for the policyholder.
Claims cannot be approved automatically as they require assessment of documents and adherence to policy terms, with settlement or rejection within 15 days of receiving the last necessary document.
Claims with missing or forged documents are considered fraudulent, and all benefits under the policy will be forfeited. Any amount already paid must be repaid by the policyholder(s) involved.

Reimbursement for expenses not related to hospitalization is not covered, except for pre-hospitalization and post-hospitalization medical expenses related to the same illness or injury, provided a primary in-patient hospitalization claim is accepted.

The insurance policy does not cover treatments like RFQMR, ECP, EECP, Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy, chondrocyte or osteocyte implantation, procedures using platelet-rich plasma, Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation, and cosmetic or plastic surgery unless medically necessary. Additionally, treatments other than Allopathy, Ayurvedic, Homeopathic, and Unani branches are not covered.
I cannot assist with that request. Fraudulent claims are prohibited, and any fraudulent activity will result in forfeiture of benefits and repayment of any amounts paid.

questions: While checking the process for submitting a dental claim for a 23-year-old financially dependent daughter (who recently married and changed her surname), also confirm the process for updating her last name in the policy records and provide the company's grievance redressal email.

For a claim submission involving robotic surgery for a spouse at "Apollo Care Hospital" (city not specified), what supporting documents are needed, how to confirm if the hospital is a network provider, and can a sibling above 26 continue as a dependent if financially dependent after job loss?

While inquiring about the maximum cashless hospitalization benefit for accidental trauma for a covered parent-in-law, simultaneously provide the claim notification procedure, and confirm the process to replace a lost ID card for another dependent.

If you wish to admit your 17-year-old son for psychiatric illness to a hospital outside your city, also request an address update for all family members, and inquire about coverage for OPD dental checkups under Gold and Platinum plans.

Describe the steps to port a prior individual policy from another insurer for a dependent parent-in-law, list documents needed for a post-hospitalization medicine claim for your child, and provide the toll-free customer service number.

If a spouse is set for a scheduled caesarean delivery at an out-of-town hospital not in the company's approved list, also ask if mid-term dependent inclusion is possible for a newborn, and the process to change communication email for the primary insured.

For submitting a claim for prosthetic limb implantation after an accident for a dependent, also check eligibility for claim under other group mediclaim policies if sum insured is exhausted, and provide details for nominating a new legal heir.

When making a cashless psychiatric care request for a dependent child at “Harmony Wellness,” at the same time, seek the critical illness survival benefit details and the list of required claim documents for a cancer diagnosis.

While requesting pre-authorization for air ambulance transfer following a road accident, also ask about process for re-issuing a lost policy document and the waiting period for new dependents included this policy year.

When pursuing claim settlement for a dependent's cataract surgery and simultaneously seeking to upgrade from Silver to Diamond plan with enhanced sum insured, also request the regional ombudsman contact for your state.

answers: To submit a dental claim, send the claim form, invoices, and necessary documents to the branch or head office. Update her last name by submitting a written request for endorsement; grievances can be addressed to the Customer Relationship Management Dept., National Insurance Company Limited.

For claim submission, provide a completed claim form, medical reports, discharge summary, payment receipts, and other relevant documents. Confirm if "Apollo Care Hospital" is a network provider by checking the insurer's network list. A sibling above 26 cannot continue as a dependent, regardless of financial dependency.

The maximum cashless hospitalization benefit for accidental trauma is subject to pre-authorization by the TPA. Notify the TPA within 24 hours for emergencies or 48 hours prior for planned admissions. For a lost ID card, contact the TPA's toll-free number for assistance.

To admit your son for psychiatric illness, ensure the hospital is medically necessary and notify the company within 48 hours of admission. Address updates can be requested at renewal, and OPD dental checkups are covered only under the Platinum plan with a maximum of Rs. 5,000 every three years.

To port a policy for a dependent parent-in-law, apply to the new insurer at least 45 days before the policy renewal date, ensuring continuous coverage without lapses. For a post-hospitalization medicine claim for your child, submit all supporting documents within 15 days of treatment completion. The toll-free customer service number is available on the health ID card.

The policy covers caesarean delivery expenses only if the hospital is a network provider; otherwise, it may not be covered. Mid-term dependent inclusion for a newborn is possible, and to change the communication email, contact details can be updated through an endorsement request.

To submit a claim for prosthetic limb implantation, provide the required documents such as the claim form, medical reports, and payment receipts. If the sum insured is exhausted, the primary insurer will coordinate with other insurers for settlement. To nominate a new legal heir, communicate the change in writing to the company, effective upon policy endorsement.

For a cashless psychiatric care request at "Harmony Wellness," submit the cashless request form and related medical information to the TPA for authorization. For critical illness survival benefit details and cancer diagnosis claim documents, refer to the policy's critical illness section and submit required medical certificates, discharge cards, and test reports.

For air ambulance transfer, the policy covers up to 5% of the sum insured for life-threatening emergencies under the Platinum Plan. To re-issue a lost policy document and inquire about the waiting period for new dependents, contact the insurer directly as specific details are not provided in the document.

To upgrade from Silver to Diamond plan, ensure no claims in the two preceding policy periods and request at renewal. For ombudsman contact details, refer to Annexure III or visit http://ecoi.co.in/ombudsman.html.

Expenses explicitly excluded under the policy cannot be claimed. The policy specifies that the insurer is not liable to reimburse medical expenses or pay amounts not specified in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.
